data.name: Solace State: Emotional Cyberpunk Stories
data.detailed_description:
Chat with us on Social Media!



About the Game




You play as Chloe, a young hacker who seeks to find her missing friend Rebecka as a biotech crackdown embroils the city of Abraxa. With political intrigue and private police surveillance at large, how will Chloe make her mark in this city? How far does she have to go to protect her friends and communities struggling to have a future worth living for?



  • Characters will remember your choices you make as Chloe. Sometimes the consequences are small, other times this can have broader city-wide ramifications
  • Choose to romance Torrent, Alden, or Sueli, or choose to have them as a close friend instead. You’ll still experience their arcs either way!
  • Multiple endings for each of the main characters, where your choices matter along the way!





  • Hand-drawn characters brimming with personality and sense of fashion
  • Painterly 3D urban landscapes
  • A dynamic storytelling experience where the camera “hacks” through urban environments to reveal key story information in 3D spaces
  • An original soundtrack by Lex Metcalfe that brings the emotions of the imaginary cyberpunk cityscape to life





  • Chloe Lee: Our intrepid, chaotic hacker protagonist
  • Rebecka Limbaco: Chloe’s mentor and oldest friend
  • Torrent Tam: An Abraxan local and a locational hacker
  • Sueli de Moraes: A community director for health services in Abraxa
  • Alden Aldridge: Chloe’s ex-lover who now works for a biotech conglomerate
  • Safore Hirawa-Sarkar: A superstar actor and producer who is Rebecka’s partner
  • Raylene Contreras Yang: A politician aiming for influence in corridors of power

We have 31 fully illustrated characters with dialogue lines in all, and many more background characters!

data.short_description: Solace State is a 3D cyberpunk visual novel about a young hacker, Chloe, who comes to her political awakening as she empowers her friends in a militarized biotech society. Your choices in conversations, the kindling of relationships, and amid escalating tensions lead to multiple endings.
data.reviews:
“The themes of privacy, security, economic inequality, and technological empowerment should feel hauntingly familiar, timely, almost urgent to anyone who occasionally browses the news.”
Kill Screen

“It’s the game’s meditation on the nature of rebellion, its psychology and its costs, that really make it… The result rhymes hacking with psychology.”
The Verge

“It looks like an engaging visual-novel experience, and a unique one, given its overt political themes, including such zeitgeist issues as immigration and surveillance.”
Fast Company

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: 2.4 GHz Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 860M
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
